meanings.definition: A type of protein found in legumes.
meanings.sent1: Legumins are important for plant growth and development.
meanings.sent2: Legumins are commonly consumed in foods like beans and lentils.
meanings.sent3: The legumins at the party were the beans and peas, always sticking together.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like legumins, binding the community together.
meanings.sent5: The legumins in the soil acted as a natural fertilizer, enriching the crops.

meanings.definition: Any of a class of simple proteins soluble in dilute salt solutions and coagulable by heat.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study legumins to understand their unique properties.
meanings.sent2: When cooking, legumins can change texture when exposed to heat.
meanings.sent3: The legumins in the experiment danced and changed shape under the heat lamp.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like legumins, solidifying his resolve to pursue his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The legumins in the test tube formed a solid mass when heated, demonstrating their coagulable nature.
